intro: Kensitia, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its long, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Kensitia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional significance in Māori culture. Its fibrous leaves have been historically used for making baskets and other woven items.
